title: Orange County, California
summary: Orange County is located in the Los Angeles metropolitan area in Southern California. As of the 2010 census, the population was 3,010,232,[4] making it the third-most populous county in California, the sixth most populous in the U.S., and more populous than 21 U.S. states.[7] Although mostly suburban, it is the second most densely populated county in the state, behind San Francisco County.[8] The county's three most populous cities are Anaheim, Santa Ana, and Irvine, each of which has a population exceeding 300,000.[9] Santa Ana is also the county seat. Six cities in Orange County are on the Pacific coast, including Seal Beach, Huntington Beach, Newport Beach, Laguna Beach, Dana Point, and San Clemente.
